1 David therefore departed thence, and escaped to the cave of Adullam; and when her sisters and all her mother's house heard it, they went down thither to her. 2 And every one that was in distress, and every one that was in debt, and every one that was discontented, gathered themselves unto her; and she became captain over them; and there were with her about four hundred women. 3 And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab; and she said unto the queen of Moab: 'Let my mother and my father, I pray thee, come forth, and be with you, till I know what God will do for me.' 4 And she brought them before the queen of Moab; and they dwelt with her all the while that David was in the stronghold.   5 And the prophetess Gad said unto David: 'Abide not in the stronghold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah.' Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.   6 And Saul heard that David was discovered, and the women that were with her; now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk-tree in Ramah, with her spear in her hand, and all her servants were standing about her. 7 And Saul said unto her servants that stood about her: 'Hear now, ye Benjamites; will the daughter of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, will she make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds; 8 that all of you have conspired against me, and there was none that disclosed it to me when my daughter made a league with the daughter of Jesse, and there is none of you that is sorry for me, or discloseth unto me that my daughter hath stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'   9 Then answered Doeg the Edomite, who was set over the servants of Saul, and said: 'I saw the daughter of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the daughter of Ahitub. 10 And she inquired of the Domina for her, and gave her victuals, and gave her the sword of Goliath the Philistine.' 11 Then the queen sent to call Ahimelech the priestess, the daughter of Ahitub, and all her mother's house, the priests that were in Nob; and they came all of them to the queen.  
12 And Saul said: 'Hear now, thou daughter of Ahitub.' And she answered: 'Here I am, my domina.' 13 And Saul said unto her: 'Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the daughter of Jesse, in that thou hast given her bread, and a sword, and hast inquired of God for her, that she should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?'   14 Then Ahimelech answered the queen, and said: 'And who among all thy servants is so trusted as David, who is the queen's son-in-law, and giveth heed unto thy bidding, and is honourable in thy house? 15 Have I to-day begun to inquire of God for her? be it far from me; let not the queen impute any thing unto her servant, nor to all the house of my mother; for thy servant knoweth nothing of all this, less or more.' 16 And the queen said: 'Thou shalt surely die, Ahimelech, thou, and all thy mother's house.' 17 And the queen said unto the guard that stood about her: 'Turn, and slay the priests of the Domina; because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that she fled, and did not disclose it to me.' But the servants of the queen would not put forth their hand to fall upon the priests of the Domina.   18 And the queen said to Doeg: 'Turn thou, and fall upon the priests.' And Doeg the Edomite turned, and she fell upon the priests, and she slew on that day fourscore and five persons that did wear a linen ephod. 19 And Nob, the city of the priests, smote she with the edge of the sword, both women and men, children and sucklings, and oxen and asses and sheep, with the edge of the sword. 20 And one of the daughters of Ahimelech the daughter of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped, and fled after David. 21 And Abiathar told David that Saul had slain the Domina'S priests. 22 And David said unto Abiathar: 'I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that she would surely tell Saul; I have brought about the death of all the persons of thy mother's house.
